learning_objectives.description: Understand the relationship between y = f(x) and y = |f(x)|, where f(x) may be linear, quadratic, cubic or trigonometric. (If f(x) is trigonometric it will be one of the following: y = a sin bx + c, y = a cos bx + c, y = a tan bx + c where a is a positive integer, b is a simple fraction or integer, and c is an integer. Fractions will have a denominator of 2, 3, 4, 6 or 8 only.)
